The company is fortunate that this happened in the middle of the night and I was too asleep to immediately drive her to the vet, or photograph the fallout. Including the panels that actually broke and I cut myself on. Cat seems okay. But you never know. And depending on how a**inine Nanoleaf is going to be about not contesting at this point the demand for a full refund, since 4 months of non-response - and I did ‚Äúlocate‚Äù a number for them, not that it did much use but added proof to my claim that I have done everything possible to contact the manufacturer.

Even Apple tried on my behalf to facilitate communication with the manufacturer, since I purchased it through the Apple Store (which was utterly not something Apple was responsible for, but Apple is utterly awesome in that way. I do my best to purchase all on my electronics through them even the non Apple brand ones, not only due to the good pricing; but also b/c they have never failed in being exceptionally helpful above and beyond their actual responsibilities, especially for non-Apple products.  SO KUDOS APPLE; and to my financial institution for dealing with a very much non-standard case for full refund).

All that being said. Even though the panels did suffer in the fall, the ones my cat did not ‚Äúcatch‚Äù didn‚Äôt survive; but the surviving ones, although on some colors they are clearly not as evenly bright as they were prior to ‚Äòutter failure of included mounting system‚Äô they do a nice job of being mounted (as opposed to floor or desk lamps) lighting for my bedroom. They respond well to Siri verbal commands, and HomeKit automations, and at 100% on pure white, they are certainly brighter than any other lighting in my bedroom, and a lot less of a hassle, both in that they are mounted on the wall and I don‚Äôt have to physically switch anything on. For an approximately 10‚Äô x 15‚Äô room, in the near vicinity they are more than sufficiently bright for any task requiring good lighting (reading, sewing, makeup application, etc.); for the room as a whole, at the aforementioned setting, I only require additional lighting if I need to do or search for something very detailed at the other end of the room. (And I like things bright-bright, as in I use 1000+ lumens lightbulbs for my desk lamps, not easy to find).

Mounting system failure aside - which is very much a manufacturing fault. 
Appearance wise, I expected them to look a bit more solid, they‚Äôre reminiscent of shoji screen paper like  appearance. Not so much as they are pictured on the manufacturer‚Äôs site.

I highly recommend using a level when mounting them; and I can see how maybe you can get 12 or so squares setup into some interesting pattern - although if you want it to look proper, it does require a level, pre-marking things on the wall, etc. I cannot imagine a full wall display setup, even if it‚Äôs square to square; it just takes a lot of precision to get them placed just right (and not misaligned or ‚Äúsloppy looking‚Äù)

The included connectors, are ... cheap p.o.c., but they *do* work; although it takes care and attention to get everything in place, as you can‚Äôt pre-connect, and then mount. Although I was somewhat surprised that when the mounting system failed, and it all came crashing down, only one of the plastic connectors was in any way damaged. 

BUT THE APP IS A DISASTER, and HomeKit integration, while - once you get it up and running - is fantastic, there is a limit of what you can do - in terms of the more fancy stuff, including (I‚Äôm assuming, I‚Äôve never found a way to make this actually work) music/TV integration - which seems to be the Nanoleaf App failure. 

THE APP REALLY IS UTTER CR*P.

I‚Äôm hoping their newer product line is more solid; it seems from the specs they did pay some attention to the fact that the canvas just failed to deliver.

THOUGH I SURE AS H*** AM NOT GOING TO TRUST ANY ADHESIVE STRIPS THAT THEY INCLUDE FOR WALL MOUNTING. 
That and the new heavy-load Velcro-type mounting systems, aside for actually being strong enough to hold up very large items (I‚Äôve a 3‚Äôx4‚Äô heavily framed artwork, that‚Äôs hanging just fine on my walls with zero issues); it‚Äôs also far easier to reconfigure how everything is set up. 

BUT SHAME ON YOU NANOLEAF.
